articles.content:
SpaceXs launch director gave the green light on Saturday to fuel the rocket for an historic flight to the International Space Station by two veteran NASA astronauts.

articles.author: HT Correspondent
articles.title: Did it keep its flavour? Stone-age ‘chewing-gum’ yields human DNA - Hindustan Times
articles.description: The Stone-Age sample yielded enough information to determine the source’s sex, what she had last eaten and the germs in her mouth. It also told them she probably had dark hair, dark skin and blue eyes.
articles.content:
Danish scientists have managed to extract a complete human DNA sample from a piece of birch pitch more than 5,000 years old, used as a kind of chewing gum, a study revealed.

articles.title: Chandrayaan exits Earth orbit, enters Moon path - Hindustan Times
articles.description: The orbit of Chandrayaan-2 has been raised five times using an on-board propulsion system [a machine to push the spacecraft forward] between July 23 and August 6, since its launch on July 22.
articles.content:
Indias second lunar mission, Chandrayaan-2, left the Earths orbit to enter the path towards the moon at 2.21 am on Wednesday.

articles.title: INNOVATION: Novel device creates electricity from snowfall - ETEnergyworld.com
articles.description: The device designed by researchers at the University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA) is inexpensive, small, thin and flexible like a sheet of plastic.

articles.title: ‘Indians are so good at mathematics and physics’: When Stephen Hawking came to India - Hindustan Times
articles.description: Scientist Stephen Hawking made a 16-day trip to India in 2001, visiting Mumbai and New Delhi. During the visit, he met then president KR Narayanan.
articles.content:
It was January 2001 when British physicist Stephen Hawking came to India for the first time, later describing the 16-day long tour as magnificent.
